title: Basic Bash Commands
description: Learn to use the Terminal with a selection of the most commonly used commands

lectures.title: Lecture 1: Where am I?
lectures.taskText: Type `pwd` either directly into the terminal or into the editor and click the 'Submit and Run' button.
lectures.lectureText: The terminal prompt is usually very short. If you want to know the path of your work directory, you can use the `pwd` command. It is short for __p__rint __w__orking __d__irectory.

lectures.title: Lecture 2: How do I move?
lectures.codeHint: Use `cd lecture` after the `cd` statement that is already in the editor. Write it on a new line.
lectures.codeHintText: Try the `cd` command to move into the directory called `lecture`.
lectures.taskText: Move into a directory called `lecture` inside the course folder. The course folder can be reached by the command that is in the editor already.
lectures.lectureText: If you want to change directories, you can use the `cd` command. It is short for __c__hange __d__irectory. Figures!

lectures.title: Lecture 3: How do I list directory contents?
lectures.summary: Knowing how to list the contents of a directory (__ls__)
lectures.codeHintText: Try the `ls` command to see the contents of your current work directory.
lectures.taskText: Enter the command to see the contents of your directory.
lectures.lectureText: To see the contents of your directory, you have to give the order to __l__i__s__t everything. The `ls` command will help you with that.
